body: Check out MU and WDC, also look at DRAM prices. Micron will report earnings at the end of March, if they give good guidance it might be a good time to buy.

author: mista_r0boto
body:
1. AMD (also WDC, WFC, and OXY on the value side)
2. Don't day trade
3. IWD right now (Value), followed by VTI
4. This is easy NTG... first bought in 2017 on Jeffrey Gundlach's recommendation... added to 2019. One of my worst investments of all time. Let's leave it at that.

author: Wobblycogs
body:
Back when I was first starting out I unwittingly bought into a pump and dump on AIM. I can't remember the name right now but I lost all my investment. It wasn't a large amount of money but it stung and I learnt my lesson. If I'm honest I'm glad I did it, what I learnt was worth the cost I paid.

My biggest screw up was advising my wife to buy Western Digital a week before they fell off a cliff. She won't let me live that one down.

author: mjr2015
body:
If  it pops to early you're barely going to feel that in your leaps


This is pretty much gambling honestly if you're bullish why not do something 45 days out? Why buy spreads at all? Why not just sell puts?

A zebra is actually a better option than the spreads. It will negate nearly all extrinsic Value and give you exposure to 100 shares

author: Bananplyte
body:
Okay so first off, /r/wallstreetbets is absolutely the wrong place to come for this.  


Second; it seems to not be all Dr Seuss books, it's the following titles:  
 *And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street*   
 *If I Ran the Zoo*   
 *McElligot’s Pool*   
 *On Beyond Zebra*   
 *Scrambled Eggs Super!*   
 *The Cat’s Quizzer*   


Third; It's ***Dr. Seuss Enterprises*** making this decision for whatever reason, so there's definitely no company you can support to stop this.  


Fourth; I can understand why they would do it to protect Dr Seuss legacy. I definitely - *in no way* \- think Dr Seuss was a racist, but the references and imagery are from a time when certain things were portrayed different from what is acceptable today. Blackface just doesn't cut it nowadays.  


You seem to mean well, but you've definitely come to the wrong place. I don't think there's much anyone can do, it's ***Dr. Seuss Enterprises*** decision to do what they want with their own books.
